1558  ImGui::DragScalar("drag u64", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, drag_speed, drag_clamp ? &u64_zero : NULL, drag_clamp ? &u64_fifty : NULL);
1559  ImGui::DragScalar("drag float", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, 0.005f, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f", 1.0f);
1560  ImGui::DragScalar("drag float ^2", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, 0.005f, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%f", 2.0f); ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("You can use the 'power' parameter to increase tweaking precision on one side of the range.");
1561  ImGui::DragScalar("drag double", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, NULL, "%.10f grams", 1.0f);
1562  ImGui::DragScalar("drag double ^2", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, 0.0005f, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "0 < %.10f < 1", 2.0f);
1563 
1564  ImGui::Text("Sliders");
1565  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s8 full", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, &s8_min, &s8_max, "%d");
1566  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u8 full", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, &u8_min, &u8_max, "%u");
1567  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s16 full", ImGuiDataType_S16, &s16_v, &s16_min, &s16_max, "%d");
1568  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u16 full", ImGuiDataType_U16, &u16_v, &u16_min, &u16_max, "%u");
1569  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 low", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_zero, &s32_fifty,"%d");
1570  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 high", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_hi_a, &s32_hi_b, "%d");
1571  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s32 full", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, &s32_min, &s32_max, "%d");
1572  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 low", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_zero, &u32_fifty,"%u");
1573  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 high", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_hi_a, &u32_hi_b, "%u");
1574  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u32 full", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, &u32_min, &u32_max, "%u");
1575  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 low", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_zero, &s64_fifty,"%I64d");
1576  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 high", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_hi_a, &s64_hi_b, "%I64d");
1577  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider s64 full", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, &s64_min, &s64_max, "%I64d");
1578  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 low", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_zero, &u64_fifty,"%I64u ms");
1579  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 high", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_hi_a, &u64_hi_b, "%I64u ms");
1580  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider u64 full", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, &u64_min, &u64_max, "%I64u ms");
1581  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float low", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_zero, &f32_one);
1582  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float low^2", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_zero, &f32_one, "%.10f", 2.0f);
1583  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider float high", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, &f32_lo_a, &f32_hi_a, "%e");
1584  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double low", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "%.10f grams", 1.0f);
1585  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double low^2",ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_zero, &f64_one, "%.10f", 2.0f);
1586  ImGui::SliderScalar("slider double high", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, &f64_lo_a, &f64_hi_a, "%e grams", 1.0f);
1587 
1588  static bool inputs_step = true;
1589  ImGui::Text("Inputs");
1590  ImGui::Checkbox("Show step buttons", &inputs_step);
1591  ImGui::InputScalar("input s8", ImGuiDataType_S8, &s8_v, inputs_step ? &s8_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
1592  ImGui::InputScalar("input u8", ImGuiDataType_U8, &u8_v, inputs_step ? &u8_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
1593  ImGui::InputScalar("input s16", ImGuiDataType_S16, &s16_v, inputs_step ? &s16_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
1594  ImGui::InputScalar("input u16", ImGuiDataType_U16, &u16_v, inputs_step ? &u16_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
1595  ImGui::InputScalar("input s32", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%d");
1596  ImGui::InputScalar("input s32 hex", ImGuiDataType_S32, &s32_v, inputs_step ? &s32_one : NULL, NULL, "%08X", ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal);
1597  ImGui::InputScalar("input u32", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%u");
1598  ImGui::InputScalar("input u32 hex", ImGuiDataType_U32, &u32_v, inputs_step ? &u32_one : NULL, NULL, "%08X", ImGuiInputTextFlags_CharsHexadecimal);
1599  ImGui::InputScalar("input s64", ImGuiDataType_S64, &s64_v, inputs_step ? &s64_one : NULL);
1600  ImGui::InputScalar("input u64", ImGuiDataType_U64, &u64_v, inputs_step ? &u64_one : NULL);
1601  ImGui::InputScalar("input float", ImGuiDataType_Float, &f32_v, inputs_step ? &f32_one : NULL);
1602  ImGui::InputScalar("input double", ImGuiDataType_Double, &f64_v, inputs_step ? &f64_one : NULL);
1603 
1604  ImGui::TreePop();
1605  }
1606 
1607  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Multi-component Widgets"))
1608  {
1609  static float vec4f[4] = { 0.10f, 0.20f, 0.30f, 0.44f };
1610  static int vec4i[4] = { 1, 5, 100, 255 };
1611 
1612  ImGui::InputFloat2("input float2", vec4f);
1613  ImGui::DragFloat2("drag float2", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1614  ImGui::SliderFloat2("slider float2", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1615  ImGui::InputInt2("input int2", vec4i);
1616  ImGui::DragInt2("drag int2", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
1617  ImGui::SliderInt2("slider int2", vec4i, 0, 255);
1618  ImGui::Spacing();
1619 
1620  ImGui::InputFloat3("input float3", vec4f);
1621  ImGui::DragFloat3("drag float3", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1622  ImGui::SliderFloat3("slider float3", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1623  ImGui::InputInt3("input int3", vec4i);
1624  ImGui::DragInt3("drag int3", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
1625  ImGui::SliderInt3("slider int3", vec4i, 0, 255);
1626  ImGui::Spacing();
1627 
1628  ImGui::InputFloat4("input float4", vec4f);
1629  ImGui::DragFloat4("drag float4", vec4f, 0.01f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1630  ImGui::SliderFloat4("slider float4", vec4f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
1631  ImGui::InputInt4("input int4", vec4i);
1632  ImGui::DragInt4("drag int4", vec4i, 1, 0, 255);
1633  ImGui::SliderInt4("slider int4", vec4i, 0, 255);
1634 
1635  ImGui::TreePop();
1636  }
1637 
1638  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical Sliders"))
1639  {
1640  const float spacing = 4;
1641  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(spacing, spacing));
1642 
1643  static int int_value = 0;
1644  ImGui::VSliderInt("##int", ImVec2(18, 160), &int_value, 0, 5);
1645  ImGui::SameLine();
1646 
1647  static float values[7] = { 0.0f, 0.60f, 0.35f, 0.9f, 0.70f, 0.20f, 0.0f };
1648  ImGui::PushID("set1");
1649  for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
1650  {
1651  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
1652  ImGui::PushID(i);
1653  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBg, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.5f, 0.5f));
1654  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBgHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.6f, 0.5f));
1655  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_FrameBgActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.7f, 0.5f));
1656  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_SliderGrab, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(i / 7.0f, 0.9f, 0.9f));
1657  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", ImVec2(18, 160), &values[i], 0.0f, 1.0f, "");
1658  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() || ImGui::IsItemHovered())
1659  ImGui::SetTooltip("%.3f", values[i]);
1660  ImGui::PopStyleColor(4);
1661  ImGui::PopID();
1662  }
1663  ImGui::PopID();
1664 
1665  ImGui::SameLine();
1666  ImGui::PushID("set2");
1667  static float values2[4] = { 0.20f, 0.80f, 0.40f, 0.25f };
1668  const int rows = 3;
1669  const ImVec2 small_slider_size(18, (float)(int)((160.0f - (rows - 1) * spacing) / rows));
1670  for (int nx = 0; nx < 4; nx++)
1671  {
1672  if (nx > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
1673  ImGui::BeginGroup();
1674  for (int ny = 0; ny < rows; ny++)
1675  {
1676  ImGui::PushID(nx * rows + ny);
1677  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", small_slider_size, &values2[nx], 0.0f, 1.0f, "");
1678  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() || ImGui::IsItemHovered())
1679  ImGui::SetTooltip("%.3f", values2[nx]);
1680  ImGui::PopID();
1681  }
1682  ImGui::EndGroup();
1683  }
1684  ImGui::PopID();
1685 
1686  ImGui::SameLine();
1687  ImGui::PushID("set3");
1688  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
1689  {
1690  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
1691  ImGui::PushID(i);
1692  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_GrabMinSize, 40);
1693  ImGui::VSliderFloat("##v", ImVec2(40, 160), &values[i], 0.0f, 1.0f, "%.2f\nsec");
1694  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
1695  ImGui::PopID();
1696  }
1697  ImGui::PopID();
1698  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
1699  ImGui::TreePop();
1700  }
1701 
1702  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and Drop"))
1703  {
1704  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and drop in standard widgets"))
1705  {
1706  // ColorEdit widgets automatically act as drag source and drag target.
1707  // They are using standardized payload strings IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_3F and IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_COLOR_4F
1708  // to allow your own widgets to use colors in their drag and drop interaction.
1709  // Also see 'Demo->Widgets->Color/Picker Widgets->Palette' demo.
1710  HelpMarker("You can drag from the colored squares.");
1711  static float col1[3] = { 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.2f };
1712  static float col2[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
1713  ImGui::ColorEdit3("color 1", col1);
1714  ImGui::ColorEdit4("color 2", col2);
1715  ImGui::TreePop();
1716  }
1717 
1718  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag and drop to copy/swap items"))
1719  {
1720  enum Mode
1721  {
1722  Mode_Copy,
1723  Mode_Move,
1724  Mode_Swap
1725  };
1726  static int mode = 0;
1727  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Copy", mode == Mode_Copy)) { mode = Mode_Copy; } ImGui::SameLine();
1728  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Move", mode == Mode_Move)) { mode = Mode_Move; } ImGui::SameLine();
1729  if (ImGui::RadioButton("Swap", mode == Mode_Swap)) { mode = Mode_Swap; }
1730  const char* names[9] =
1731  {
1732  "Bobby", "Beatrice", "Betty",
1733  "Brianna", "Barry", "Bernard",
1734  "Bibi", "Blaine", "Bryn"
1735  };
1736  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); n++)
1737  {
1738  ImGui::PushID(n);
1739  if ((n % 3) != 0)
1740  ImGui::SameLine();
1741  ImGui::Button(names[n], ImVec2(60, 60));
1742 
1743  // Our buttons are both drag sources and drag targets here!
1744  if (ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags_None))
1745  {
1746  // Set payload to carry the index of our item (could be anything)
1747  ImGui::SetDragDropPayload("DND_DEMO_CELL", &n, sizeof(int));
1748 
1749  // Display preview (could be anything, e.g. when dragging an image we could decide to display
1750  // the filename and a small preview of the image, etc.)
1751  if (mode == Mode_Copy) { ImGui::Text("Copy %s", names[n]); }
1752  if (mode == Mode_Move) { ImGui::Text("Move %s", names[n]); }
1753  if (mode == Mode_Swap) { ImGui::Text("Swap %s", names[n]); }
1754  ImGui::EndDragDropSource();
1755  }
1756  if (ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget())
1757  {
1758  if (const ImGuiPayload* payload = ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload("DND_DEMO_CELL"))
1759  {
1760  IM_ASSERT(payload->DataSize == sizeof(int));
1761  int payload_n = *(const int*)payload->Data;
1762  if (mode == Mode_Copy)
1763  {
1764  names[n] = names[payload_n];
1765  }
1766  if (mode == Mode_Move)
1767  {
1768  names[n] = names[payload_n];
1769  names[payload_n] = "";
1770  }
1771  if (mode == Mode_Swap)
1772  {
1773  const char* tmp = names[n];
1774  names[n] = names[payload_n];
1775  names[payload_n] = tmp;
1776  }
1777  }
1778  ImGui::EndDragDropTarget();
1779  }
1780  ImGui::PopID();
1781  }
1782  ImGui::TreePop();
1783  }
1784 
1785  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Drag to reorder items (simple)"))
1786  {
1787  // Simple reordering
1788  HelpMarker(
1789  "We don't use the drag and drop api at all here! "
1790  "Instead we query when the item is held but not hovered, and order items accordingly.");
1791  static const char* item_names[] = { "Item One", "Item Two", "Item Three", "Item Four", "Item Five" };
1792  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names); n++)
1793  {
1794  const char* item = item_names[n];
1795  ImGui::Selectable(item);
1796 
1797  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && !ImGui::IsItemHovered())
1798  {
1799  int n_next = n + (ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0).y < 0.f ? -1 : 1);
1800  if (n_next >= 0 && n_next < IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names))
1801  {
1802  item_names[n] = item_names[n_next];
1803  item_names[n_next] = item;
1804  ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta();
1805  }
1806  }
1807  }
1808  ImGui::TreePop();
1809  }
1810 
1811  ImGui::TreePop();
1812  }
1813 
1814  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Querying Status (Active/Focused/Hovered etc.)"))
1815  {
1816  // Select an item type
1817  const char* item_names[] =
1818  {
1819  "Text", "Button", "Button (w/ repeat)", "Checkbox", "SliderFloat", "InputText", "InputFloat",
1820  "InputFloat3", "ColorEdit4", "MenuItem", "TreeNode", "TreeNode (w/ double-click)", "ListBox"
1821  };
1822  static int item_type = 1;
1823  ImGui::Combo("Item Type", &item_type, item_names, IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names), IM_ARRAYSIZE(item_names));
1824  ImGui::SameLine();
1825  HelpMarker("Testing how various types of items are interacting with the IsItemXXX functions.");
1826 
1827  // Submit selected item item so we can query their status in the code following it.
1828  bool ret = false;
1829  static bool b = false;
1830  static float col4f[4] = { 1.0f, 0.5, 0.0f, 1.0f };
1831  static char str[16] = {};
1832  if (item_type == 0) { ImGui::Text("ITEM: Text"); } // Testing text items with no identifier/interaction
1833  if (item_type == 1) { ret = ImGui::Button("ITEM: Button"); } // Testing button
1834  if (item_type == 2) { ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(true); ret = ImGui::Button("ITEM: Button"); ImGui::PopButtonRepeat(); } // Testing button (with repeater)
1835  if (item_type == 3) { ret = ImGui::Checkbox("ITEM: Checkbox", &b); } // Testing checkbox
1836  if (item_type == 4) { ret = ImGui::SliderFloat("ITEM: SliderFloat", &col4f[0], 0.0f, 1.0f); } // Testing basic item
1837  if (item_type == 5) { ret = ImGui::InputText("ITEM: InputText", &str[0], IM_ARRAYSIZE(str)); } // Testing input text (which handles tabbing)
1838  if (item_type == 6) { ret = ImGui::InputFloat("ITEM: InputFloat", col4f, 1.0f); } // Testing +/- buttons on scalar input
1839  if (item_type == 7) { ret = ImGui::InputFloat3("ITEM: InputFloat3", col4f); } // Testing multi-component items (IsItemXXX flags are reported merged)
1840  if (item_type == 8) { ret = ImGui::ColorEdit4("ITEM: ColorEdit4", col4f); } // Testing multi-component items (IsItemXXX flags are reported merged)
1841  if (item_type == 9) { ret = ImGui::MenuItem("ITEM: MenuItem"); } // Testing menu item (they use ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnRelease button policy)
1842  if (item_type == 10){ ret = ImGui::TreeNode("ITEM: TreeNode"); if (ret) ImGui::TreePop(); } // Testing tree node
1843  if (item_type == 11){ ret = ImGui::TreeNodeEx("ITEM: TreeNode w/ ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick", ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen); } // Testing tree node with ImGuiButtonFlags_PressedOnDoubleClick button policy.
1844  if (item_type == 12){ const char* items[] = { "Apple", "Banana", "Cherry", "Kiwi" }; static int current = 1; ret = ImGui::ListBox("ITEM: ListBox", &current, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items), IM_ARRAYSIZE(items)); }
1845 
1846  // Display the values of IsItemHovered() and other common item state functions.
1847  // Note that the ImGuiHoveredFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
1848  // Because BulletText is an item itself and that would affect the output of IsItemXXX functions,
1849  // we query every state in a single call to avoid storing them and to simplify the code.
1850  ImGui::BulletText(
1851  "Return value = %d\n"
1852  "IsItemFocused() = %d\n"
1853  "IsItemHovered() = %d\n"
1854  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
1855  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) = %d\n"
1856  "IsItemHovered(_AllowWhenOverlapped) = %d\n"
1857  "IsItemHovered(_RectOnly) = %d\n"
1858  "IsItemActive() = %d\n"
1859  "IsItemEdited() = %d\n"
1860  "IsItemActivated() = %d\n"
1861  "IsItemDeactivated() = %d\n"
1862  "IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit() = %d\n"
1863  "IsItemVisible() = %d\n"
1864  "IsItemClicked() = %d\n"
1865  "IsItemToggledOpen() = %d\n"
1866  "GetItemRectMin() = (%.1f, %.1f)\n"
1867  "GetItemRectMax() = (%.1f, %.1f)\n"
1868  "GetItemRectSize() = (%.1f, %.1f)",
1869  ret,
1870  ImGui::IsItemFocused(),
1871  ImGui::IsItemHovered(),
1872  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
1873  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem),
1874  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped),
1875  ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RectOnly),
1876  ImGui::IsItemActive(),
1877  ImGui::IsItemEdited(),
1878  ImGui::IsItemActivated(),
1879  ImGui::IsItemDeactivated(),
1880  ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit(),
1881  ImGui::IsItemVisible(),
1882  ImGui::IsItemClicked(),
1883  ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen(),
1884  ImGui::GetItemRectMin().x, ImGui::GetItemRectMin().y,
1885  ImGui::GetItemRectMax().x, ImGui::GetItemRectMax().y,
1886  ImGui::GetItemRectSize().x, ImGui::GetItemRectSize().y
1887  );
1888 
1889  static bool embed_all_inside_a_child_window = false;
1890  ImGui::Checkbox("Embed everything inside a child window (for additional testing)", &embed_all_inside_a_child_window);
1891  if (embed_all_inside_a_child_window)
1892  ImGui::BeginChild("outer_child", ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f), true);
1893 
1894  // Testing IsWindowFocused() function with its various flags.
1895  // Note that the ImGuiFocusedFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
1896  ImGui::BulletText(
1897  "IsWindowFocused() = %d\n"
1898  "IsWindowFocused(_ChildWindows) = %d\n"
1899  "IsWindowFocused(_ChildWindows|_RootWindow) = %d\n"
1900  "IsWindowFocused(_RootWindow) = %d\n"
1901  "IsWindowFocused(_AnyWindow) = %d\n",
1902  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(),
1903  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows),
1904  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow),
1905  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow),
1906  ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow));
1907 
1908  // Testing IsWindowHovered() function with its various flags.
1909  // Note that the ImGuiHoveredFlags_XXX flags can be combined.
1910  ImGui::BulletText(
1911  "IsWindowHovered() = %d\n"
1912  "IsWindowHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
1913  "IsWindowHovered(_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) = %d\n"
1914  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows) = %d\n"
1915  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows|_RootWindow) = %d\n"
1916  "IsWindowHovered(_ChildWindows|_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) = %d\n"
1917  "IsWindowHovered(_RootWindow) = %d\n"
1918  "IsWindowHovered(_AnyWindow) = %d\n",
1919  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(),
1920  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
1921  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem),
1922  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows),
1923  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow),
1924  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows | ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup),
1925  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow),
1926  ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow));
1927 
1928  ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 50), true);
1929  ImGui::Text("This is another child window for testing the _ChildWindows flag.");
1930  ImGui::EndChild();
1931  if (embed_all_inside_a_child_window)
1932  ImGui::EndChild();
1933 
1934  static char dummy_str[] = "This is a dummy field to be able to tab-out of the widgets above.";
1935  ImGui::InputText("dummy", dummy_str, IM_ARRAYSIZE(dummy_str), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
1936 
1937  // Calling IsItemHovered() after begin returns the hovered status of the title bar.
1938  // This is useful in particular if you want to create a context menu associated to the title bar of a window.
1939  static bool test_window = false;
1940  ImGui::Checkbox("Hovered/Active tests after Begin() for title bar testing", &test_window);
1941  if (test_window)
1942  {
1943  ImGui::Begin("Title bar Hovered/Active tests", &test_window);
1944  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem()) // <-- This is using IsItemHovered()
1945  {
1946  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) { test_window = false; }
1947  ImGui::EndPopup();
1948  }
1949  ImGui::Text(
1950  "IsItemHovered() after begin = %d (== is title bar hovered)\n"
1951  "IsItemActive() after begin = %d (== is window being clicked/moved)\n",
1952  ImGui::IsItemHovered(), ImGui::IsItemActive());
1953  ImGui::End();
1954  }
1955 
1956  ImGui::TreePop();
1957  }
1958 }
1959 
1960 static void ShowDemoWindowLayout()
1961 {
1962  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Layout"))
1963  return;
1964 
1965  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Child windows"))
1966  {
1967  HelpMarker("Use child windows to begin into a self-contained independent scrolling/clipping regions within a host window.");
1968  static bool disable_mouse_wheel = false;
1969  static bool disable_menu = false;
1970  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable Mouse Wheel", &disable_mouse_wheel);
1971  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable Menu", &disable_menu);
1972 
1973  // Child 1: no border, enable horizontal scrollbar
1974  {
1975  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar;
1976  if (disable_mouse_wheel)
1977  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse;
1978  ImGui::BeginChild("ChildL", ImVec2(ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionWidth() * 0.5f, 260), false, window_flags);
1979  for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
1980  ImGui::Text("%04d: scrollable region", i);
1981  ImGui::EndChild();
1982  }
1983 
1984  ImGui::SameLine();
1985 
1986  // Child 2: rounded border
1987  {
1988  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_None;
1989  if (disable_mouse_wheel)
1990  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse;
1991  if (!disable_menu)
1992  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar;
1993  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, 5.0f);
1994  ImGui::BeginChild("ChildR", ImVec2(0, 260), true, window_flags);
1995  if (!disable_menu && ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
1996  {
1997  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu"))
1998  {
1999  ShowExampleMenuFile();
2000  ImGui::EndMenu();
2001  }
2002  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
2003  }
2004  ImGui::Columns(2);
2005  for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
2006  {
2007  char buf[32];
2008  sprintf(buf, "%03d", i);
2009  ImGui::Button(buf, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
2010  ImGui::NextColumn();
2011  }
2012  ImGui::EndChild();
2013  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2014  }
2015 
2016  ImGui::Separator();
2017 
2018  // Demonstrate a few extra things
2019  // - Changing ImGuiCol_ChildBg (which is transparent black in default styles)
2020  // - Using SetCursorPos() to position child window (the child window is an item from the POV of parent window)
2021  // You can also call SetNextWindowPos() to position the child window. The parent window will effectively
2022  // layout from this position.
2023  // - Using ImGui::GetItemRectMin/Max() to query the "item" state (because the child window is an item from
2024  // the POV of the parent window). See 'Demo->Querying Status (Active/Focused/Hovered etc.)' for details.
2025  {
2026  static int offset_x = 0;
2027  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
2028  ImGui::DragInt("Offset X", &offset_x, 1.0f, -1000, 1000);
2029 
2030  ImGui::SetCursorPosX(ImGui::GetCursorPosX() + (float)offset_x);
2031  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 100));
2032  ImGui::BeginChild("Red", ImVec2(200, 100), true, ImGuiWindowFlags_None);
2033  for (int n = 0; n < 50; n++)
2034  ImGui::Text("Some test %d", n);
2035  ImGui::EndChild();
2036  bool child_is_hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
2037  ImVec2 child_rect_min = ImGui::GetItemRectMin();
2038  ImVec2 child_rect_max = ImGui::GetItemRectMax();
2039  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
2040  ImGui::Text("Hovered: %d", child_is_hovered);
2041  ImGui::Text("Rect of child window is: (%.0f,%.0f) (%.0f,%.0f)", child_rect_min.x, child_rect_min.y, child_rect_max.x, child_rect_max.y);
2042  }
2043 
2044  ImGui::TreePop();
2045  }
2046 
2047  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Widgets Width"))
2048  {
2049  // Use SetNextItemWidth() to set the width of a single upcoming item.
2050  // Use PushItemWidth()/PopItemWidth() to set the width of a group of items.
2051  // In real code use you'll probably want to choose width values that are proportional to your font size
2052  // e.g. Using '20.0f * GetFontSize()' as width instead of '200.0f', etc.
2053 
2054  static float f = 0.0f;
2055  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(100)");
2056  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Fixed width.");
2057  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
2058  ImGui::DragFloat("float##1", &f);
2059 
2060  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(GetWindowWidth() * 0.5f)");
2061  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Half of window width.");
2062  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetWindowWidth() * 0.5f);
2063  ImGui::DragFloat("float##2", &f);
2064 
2065  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f)");
2066  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Half of available width.\n(~ right-cursor_pos)\n(works within a column set)");
2067  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x * 0.5f);
2068  ImGui::DragFloat("float##3", &f);
2069 
2070  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(-100)");
2071  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Align to right edge minus 100");
2072  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-100);
2073  ImGui::DragFloat("float##4", &f);
2074 
2075  // Demonstrate using PushItemWidth to surround three items.
2076  // Calling SetNextItemWidth() before each of them would have the same effect.
2077  ImGui::Text("SetNextItemWidth/PushItemWidth(-1)");
2078  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Align to right edge");
2079  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-1);
2080  ImGui::DragFloat("##float5a", &f);
2081  ImGui::DragFloat("##float5b", &f);
2082  ImGui::DragFloat("##float5c", &f);
2083  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2084 
2085  ImGui::TreePop();
2086  }
2087 
2088  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic Horizontal Layout"))
2089  {
2090  ImGui::TextWrapped("(Use ImGui::SameLine() to keep adding items to the right of the preceding item)");
2091 
2092  // Text
2093  ImGui::Text("Two items: Hello"); ImGui::SameLine();
2094  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1,1,0,1), "Sailor");
2095 
2096  // Adjust spacing
2097  ImGui::Text("More spacing: Hello"); ImGui::SameLine(0, 20);
2098  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1,1,0,1), "Sailor");
2099 
2100  // Button
2101  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2102  ImGui::Text("Normal buttons"); ImGui::SameLine();
2103  ImGui::Button("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2104  ImGui::Button("Apple"); ImGui::SameLine();
2105  ImGui::Button("Corniflower");
2106 
2107  // Button
2108  ImGui::Text("Small buttons"); ImGui::SameLine();
2109  ImGui::SmallButton("Like this one"); ImGui::SameLine();
2110  ImGui::Text("can fit within a text block.");
2111 
2112  // Aligned to arbitrary position. Easy/cheap column.
2113  ImGui::Text("Aligned");
2114  ImGui::SameLine(150); ImGui::Text("x=150");
2115  ImGui::SameLine(300); ImGui::Text("x=300");
2116  ImGui::Text("Aligned");
2117  ImGui::SameLine(150); ImGui::SmallButton("x=150");
2118  ImGui::SameLine(300); ImGui::SmallButton("x=300");
2119 
2120  // Checkbox
2121  static bool c1 = false, c2 = false, c3 = false, c4 = false;
2122  ImGui::Checkbox("My", &c1); ImGui::SameLine();
2123  ImGui::Checkbox("Tailor", &c2); ImGui::SameLine();
2124  ImGui::Checkbox("Is", &c3); ImGui::SameLine();
2125  ImGui::Checkbox("Rich", &c4);
2126 
2127  // Various
2128  static float f0 = 1.0f, f1 = 2.0f, f2 = 3.0f;
2129  ImGui::PushItemWidth(80);
2130  const char* items[] = { "AAAA", "BBBB", "CCCC", "DDDD" };
2131  static int item = -1;
2132  ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items)); ImGui::SameLine();
2133  ImGui::SliderFloat("X", &f0, 0.0f, 5.0f); ImGui::SameLine();
2134  ImGui::SliderFloat("Y", &f1, 0.0f, 5.0f); ImGui::SameLine();
2135  ImGui::SliderFloat("Z", &f2, 0.0f, 5.0f);
2136  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2137 
2138  ImGui::PushItemWidth(80);
2139  ImGui::Text("Lists:");
2140  static int selection[4] = { 0, 1, 2, 3 };
2141  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
2142  {
2143  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2144  ImGui::PushID(i);
2145  ImGui::ListBox("", &selection[i], items, IM_ARRAYSIZE(items));
2146  ImGui::PopID();
2147  //if (ImGui::IsItemHovered()) ImGui::SetTooltip("ListBox %d hovered", i);
2148  }
2149  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2150 
2151  // Dummy
2152  ImVec2 button_sz(40, 40);
2153  ImGui::Button("A", button_sz); ImGui::SameLine();
2154  ImGui::Dummy(button_sz); ImGui::SameLine();
2155  ImGui::Button("B", button_sz);
2156 
2157  // Manually wrapping
2158  // (we should eventually provide this as an automatic layout feature, but for now you can do it manually)
2159  ImGui::Text("Manually wrapping:");
2160  ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
2161  int buttons_count = 20;
2162  float window_visible_x2 = ImGui::GetWindowPos().x + ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax().x;
2163  for (int n = 0; n < buttons_count; n++)
2164  {
2165  ImGui::PushID(n);
2166  ImGui::Button("Box", button_sz);
2167  float last_button_x2 = ImGui::GetItemRectMax().x;
2168  float next_button_x2 = last_button_x2 + style.ItemSpacing.x + button_sz.x; // Expected position if next button was on same line
2169  if (n + 1 < buttons_count && next_button_x2 < window_visible_x2)
2170  ImGui::SameLine();
2171  ImGui::PopID();
2172  }
2173 
2174  ImGui::TreePop();
2175  }
2176 
2177  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabs"))
2178  {
2179  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
2180  {
2181  ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_None;
2182  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("MyTabBar", tab_bar_flags))
2183  {
2184  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Avocado"))
2185  {
2186  ImGui::Text("This is the Avocado tab!\nblah blah blah blah blah");
2187  ImGui::EndTabItem();
2188  }
2189  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Broccoli"))
2190  {
2191  ImGui::Text("This is the Broccoli tab!\nblah blah blah blah blah");
2192  ImGui::EndTabItem();
2193  }
2194  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("Cucumber"))
2195  {
2196  ImGui::Text("This is the Cucumber tab!\nblah blah blah blah blah");
2197  ImGui::EndTabItem();
2198  }
2199  ImGui::EndTabBar();
2200  }
2201  ImGui::Separator();
2202  ImGui::TreePop();
2203  }
2204 
2205  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced & Close Button"))
2206  {
2207  // Expose a couple of the available flags. In most cases you may just call BeginTabBar() with no flags (0).
2208  static ImGuiTabBarFlags tab_bar_flags = ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable;
2209  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_Reorderable);
2210  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_AutoSelectNewTabs);
2211  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_TabListPopupButton);
2212  ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton);
2213  if ((tab_bar_flags & ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_) == 0)
2214  tab_bar_flags |= ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyDefault_;
2215  if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown))
2216  tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyResizeDown);
2217  if (ImGui::CheckboxFlags("ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll", (unsigned int*)&tab_bar_flags, ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll))
2218  tab_bar_flags &= ~(ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyMask_ ^ ImGuiTabBarFlags_FittingPolicyScroll);
2219 
2220  // Tab Bar
2221  const char* names[4] = { "Artichoke", "Beetroot", "Celery", "Daikon" };
2222  static bool opened[4] = { true, true, true, true }; // Persistent user state
2223  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(opened); n++)
2224  {
2225  if (n > 0) { ImGui::SameLine(); }
2226  ImGui::Checkbox(names[n], &opened[n]);
2227  }
2228 
2229  // Passing a bool* to BeginTabItem() is similar to passing one to Begin():
2230  // the underlying bool will be set to false when the tab is closed.
2231  if (ImGui::BeginTabBar("MyTabBar", tab_bar_flags))
2232  {
2233  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(opened); n++)
2234  if (opened[n] && ImGui::BeginTabItem(names[n], &opened[n], ImGuiTabItemFlags_None))
2235  {
2236  ImGui::Text("This is the %s tab!", names[n]);
2237  if (n & 1)
2238  ImGui::Text("I am an odd tab.");
2239  ImGui::EndTabItem();
2240  }
2241  ImGui::EndTabBar();
2242  }
2243  ImGui::Separator();
2244  ImGui::TreePop();
2245  }
2246  ImGui::TreePop();
2247  }
2248 
2249  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Groups"))
2250  {
2251  HelpMarker(
2252  "BeginGroup() basically locks the horizontal position for new line. "
2253  "EndGroup() bundles the whole group so that you can use \"item\" functions such as "
2254  "IsItemHovered()/IsItemActive() or SameLine() etc. on the whole group.");
2255  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2256  {
2257  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2258  ImGui::Button("AAA");
2259  ImGui::SameLine();
2260  ImGui::Button("BBB");
2261  ImGui::SameLine();
2262  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2263  ImGui::Button("CCC");
2264  ImGui::Button("DDD");
2265  ImGui::EndGroup();
2266  ImGui::SameLine();
2267  ImGui::Button("EEE");
2268  ImGui::EndGroup();
2269  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2270  ImGui::SetTooltip("First group hovered");
2271  }
2272  // Capture the group size and create widgets using the same size
2273  ImVec2 size = ImGui::GetItemRectSize();
2274  const float values[5] = { 0.5f, 0.20f, 0.80f, 0.60f, 0.25f };
2275  ImGui::PlotHistogram("##values", values, IM_ARRAYSIZE(values), 0, NULL, 0.0f, 1.0f, size);
2276 
2277  ImGui::Button("ACTION", ImVec2((size.x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.x) * 0.5f, size.y));
2278  ImGui::SameLine();
2279  ImGui::Button("REACTION", ImVec2((size.x - ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.x) * 0.5f, size.y));
2280  ImGui::EndGroup();
2281  ImGui::SameLine();
2282 
2283  ImGui::Button("LEVERAGE\nBUZZWORD", size);
2284  ImGui::SameLine();
2285 
2286  if (ImGui::ListBoxHeader("List", size))
2287  {
2288  ImGui::Selectable("Selected", true);
2289  ImGui::Selectable("Not Selected", false);
2290  ImGui::ListBoxFooter();
2291  }
2292 
2293  ImGui::TreePop();
2294  }
2295 
2296  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Text Baseline Alignment"))
2297  {
2298  {
2299  ImGui::BulletText("Text baseline:");
2300  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
2301  "This is testing the vertical alignment that gets applied on text to keep it aligned with widgets. "
2302  "Lines only composed of text or \"small\" widgets use less vertical space than lines with framed widgets.");
2303  ImGui::Indent();
2304 
2305  ImGui::Text("KO Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();
2306  ImGui::Button("Some framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2307  HelpMarker("Baseline of button will look misaligned with text..");
2308 
2309  // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
2310  // (because we don't know what's coming after the Text() statement, we need to move the text baseline
2311  // down by FramePadding.y ahead of time)
2312  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2313  ImGui::Text("OK Blahblah"); ImGui::SameLine();
2314  ImGui::Button("Some framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2315  HelpMarker("We call AlignTextToFramePadding() to vertically align the text baseline by +FramePadding.y");
2316 
2317  // SmallButton() uses the same vertical padding as Text
2318  ImGui::Button("TEST##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2319  ImGui::Text("TEST"); ImGui::SameLine();
2320  ImGui::SmallButton("TEST##2");
2321 
2322  // If your line starts with text, call AlignTextToFramePadding() to align text to upcoming widgets.
2323  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2324  ImGui::Text("Text aligned to framed item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2325  ImGui::Button("Item##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2326  ImGui::Text("Item"); ImGui::SameLine();
2327  ImGui::SmallButton("Item##2"); ImGui::SameLine();
2328  ImGui::Button("Item##3");
2329 
2330  ImGui::Unindent();
2331  }
2332 
2333  ImGui::Spacing();
2334 
2335  {
2336  ImGui::BulletText("Multi-line text:");
2337  ImGui::Indent();
2338  ImGui::Text("One\nTwo\nThree"); ImGui::SameLine();
2339  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2340  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2341 
2342  ImGui::Text("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2343  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2344  ImGui::Text("One\nTwo\nThree");
2345 
2346  ImGui::Button("HOP##1"); ImGui::SameLine();
2347  ImGui::Text("Banana"); ImGui::SameLine();
2348  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2349  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2350 
2351  ImGui::Button("HOP##2"); ImGui::SameLine();
2352  ImGui::Text("Hello\nWorld"); ImGui::SameLine();
2353  ImGui::Text("Banana");
2354  ImGui::Unindent();
2355  }
2356 
2357  ImGui::Spacing();
2358 
2359  {
2360  ImGui::BulletText("Misc items:");
2361  ImGui::Indent();
2362 
2363  // SmallButton() sets FramePadding to zero. Text baseline is aligned to match baseline of previous Button.
2364  ImGui::Button("80x80", ImVec2(80, 80));
2365  ImGui::SameLine();
2366  ImGui::Button("50x50", ImVec2(50, 50));
2367  ImGui::SameLine();
2368  ImGui::Button("Button()");
2369  ImGui::SameLine();
2370  ImGui::SmallButton("SmallButton()");
2371 
2372  // Tree
2373  const float spacing = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemInnerSpacing.x;
2374  ImGui::Button("Button##1");
2375  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
2376  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Node##1"))
2377  {
2378  // Dummy tree data
2379  for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
2380  ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
2381  ImGui::TreePop();
2382  }
2383 
2384  // Vertically align text node a bit lower so it'll be vertically centered with upcoming widget.
2385  // Otherwise you can use SmallButton() (smaller fit).
2386  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2387 
2388  // Common mistake to avoid: if we want to SameLine after TreeNode we need to do it before we add
2389  // other contents below the node.
2390  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Node##2");
2391  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##2");
2392  if (node_open)
2393  {
2394  // Dummy tree data
2395  for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
2396  ImGui::BulletText("Item %d..", i);
2397  ImGui::TreePop();
2398  }
2399 
2400  // Bullet
2401  ImGui::Button("Button##3");
2402  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing);
2403  ImGui::BulletText("Bullet text");
2404 
2405  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
2406  ImGui::BulletText("Node");
2407  ImGui::SameLine(0.0f, spacing); ImGui::Button("Button##4");
2408  ImGui::Unindent();
2409  }
2410 
2411  ImGui::TreePop();
2412  }
2413 
2414  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Scrolling"))
2415  {
2416  // Vertical scroll functions
2417  HelpMarker("Use SetScrollHereY() or SetScrollFromPosY() to scroll to a given vertical position.");
2418 
2419  static int track_item = 50;
2420  static bool enable_track = true;
2421  static bool enable_extra_decorations = false;
2422  static float scroll_to_off_px = 0.0f;
2423  static float scroll_to_pos_px = 200.0f;
2424 
2425  ImGui::Checkbox("Decoration", &enable_extra_decorations);
2426 
2427  ImGui::Checkbox("Track", &enable_track);
2428  ImGui::PushItemWidth(100);
2429  ImGui::SameLine(140); enable_track |= ImGui::DragInt("##item", &track_item, 0.25f, 0, 99, "Item = %d");
2430 
2431  bool scroll_to_off = ImGui::Button("Scroll Offset");
2432  ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_off |= ImGui::DragFloat("##off", &scroll_to_off_px, 1.00f, 0, FLT_MAX, "+%.0f px");
2433 
2434  bool scroll_to_pos = ImGui::Button("Scroll To Pos");
2435  ImGui::SameLine(140); scroll_to_pos |= ImGui::DragFloat("##pos", &scroll_to_pos_px, 1.00f, -10, FLT_MAX, "X/Y = %.0f px");
2436  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2437 
2438  if (scroll_to_off || scroll_to_pos)
2439  enable_track = false;
2440 
2441  ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
2442  float child_w = (ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x - 4 * style.ItemSpacing.x) / 5;
2443  if (child_w < 1.0f)
2444  child_w = 1.0f;
2445  ImGui::PushID("##VerticalScrolling");
2446  for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
2447  {
2448  if (i > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2449  ImGui::BeginGroup();
2450  const char* names[] = { "Top", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Bottom" };
2451  ImGui::TextUnformatted(names[i]);
2452 
2453  const ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar : 0;
2454  const ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
2455  const bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(child_w, 200.0f), true, child_flags);
2456  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
2457  {
2458  ImGui::TextUnformatted("abc");
2459  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
2460  }
2461  if (scroll_to_off)
2462  ImGui::SetScrollY(scroll_to_off_px);
2463  if (scroll_to_pos)
2464  ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().y + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
2465  if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
2466  {
2467  for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
2468  {
2469  if (enable_track && item == track_item)
2470  {
2471  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
2472  ImGui::SetScrollHereY(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:top, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:bottom
2473  }
2474  else
2475  {
2476  ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
2477  }
2478  }
2479  }
2480  float scroll_y = ImGui::GetScrollY();
2481  float scroll_max_y = ImGui::GetScrollMaxY();
2482  ImGui::EndChild();
2483  ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_y, scroll_max_y);
2484  ImGui::EndGroup();
2485  }
2486  ImGui::PopID();
2487 
2488  // Horizontal scroll functions
2489  ImGui::Spacing();
2490  HelpMarker(
2491  "Use SetScrollHereX() or SetScrollFromPosX() to scroll to a given horizontal position.\n\n"
2492  "Using the \"Scroll To Pos\" button above will make the discontinuity at edges visible: "
2493  "scrolling to the top/bottom/left/right-most item will add an additional WindowPadding to reflect "
2494  "on reaching the edge of the list.\n\nBecause the clipping rectangle of most window hides half "
2495  "worth of WindowPadding on the left/right, using SetScrollFromPosX(+1) will usually result in "
2496  "clipped text whereas the equivalent SetScrollFromPosY(+1) wouldn't.");
2497  ImGui::PushID("##HorizontalScrolling");
2498  for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
2499  {
2500  float child_height = ImGui::GetTextLineHeight() + style.ScrollbarSize + style.WindowPadding.y * 2.0f;
2501  ImGuiWindowFlags child_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar | (enable_extra_decorations ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar : 0);
2502  ImGuiID child_id = ImGui::GetID((void*)(intptr_t)i);
2503  bool child_is_visible = ImGui::BeginChild(child_id, ImVec2(-100, child_height), true, child_flags);
2504  if (scroll_to_off)
2505  ImGui::SetScrollX(scroll_to_off_px);
2506  if (scroll_to_pos)
2507  ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGui::GetCursorStartPos().x + scroll_to_pos_px, i * 0.25f);
2508  if (child_is_visible) // Avoid calling SetScrollHereY when running with culled items
2509  {
2510  for (int item = 0; item < 100; item++)
2511  {
2512  if (enable_track && item == track_item)
2513  {
2514  ImGui::TextColored(ImVec4(1, 1, 0, 1), "Item %d", item);
2515  ImGui::SetScrollHereX(i * 0.25f); // 0.0f:left, 0.5f:center, 1.0f:right
2516  }
2517  else
2518  {
2519  ImGui::Text("Item %d", item);
2520  }
2521  ImGui::SameLine();
2522  }
2523  }
2524  float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
2525  float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
2526  ImGui::EndChild();
2527  ImGui::SameLine();
2528  const char* names[] = { "Left", "25%", "Center", "75%", "Right" };
2529  ImGui::Text("%s\n%.0f/%.0f", names[i], scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
2530  ImGui::Spacing();
2531  }
2532  ImGui::PopID();
2533 
2534  // Miscellaneous Horizontal Scrolling Demo
2535  HelpMarker(
2536  "Horizontal scrolling for a window is enabled via the ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar flag.\n\n"
2537  "You may want to also explicitly specify content width by using SetNextWindowContentWidth() before Begin().");
2538  static int lines = 7;
2539  ImGui::SliderInt("Lines", &lines, 1, 15);
2540  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FrameRounding, 3.0f);
2541  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2.0f, 1.0f));
2542  ImVec2 scrolling_child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing() * 7 + 30);
2543  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", scrolling_child_size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
2544  for (int line = 0; line < lines; line++)
2545  {
2546  // Display random stuff. For the sake of this trivial demo we are using basic Button() + SameLine()
2547  // If you want to create your own time line for a real application you may be better off manipulating
2548  // the cursor position yourself, aka using SetCursorPos/SetCursorScreenPos to position the widgets
2549  // yourself. You may also want to use the lower-level ImDrawList API.
2550  int num_buttons = 10 + ((line & 1) ? line * 9 : line * 3);
2551  for (int n = 0; n < num_buttons; n++)
2552  {
2553  if (n > 0) ImGui::SameLine();
2554  ImGui::PushID(n + line * 1000);
2555  char num_buf[16];
2556  sprintf(num_buf, "%d", n);
2557  const char* label = (!(n % 15)) ? "FizzBuzz" : (!(n % 3)) ? "Fizz" : (!(n % 5)) ? "Buzz" : num_buf;
2558  float hue = n * 0.05f;
2559  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Button, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.6f, 0.6f));
2560  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.7f, 0.7f));
2561  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ButtonActive, (ImVec4)ImColor::HSV(hue, 0.8f, 0.8f));
2562  ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(40.0f + sinf((float)(line + n)) * 20.0f, 0.0f));
2563  ImGui::PopStyleColor(3);
2564  ImGui::PopID();
2565  }
2566  }
2567  float scroll_x = ImGui::GetScrollX();
2568  float scroll_max_x = ImGui::GetScrollMaxX();
2569  ImGui::EndChild();
2570  ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
2571  float scroll_x_delta = 0.0f;
2572  ImGui::SmallButton("<<");
2573  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
2574  scroll_x_delta = -ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
2575  ImGui::SameLine();
2576  ImGui::Text("Scroll from code"); ImGui::SameLine();
2577  ImGui::SmallButton(">>");
2578  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
2579  scroll_x_delta = +ImGui::GetIO().DeltaTime * 1000.0f;
2580  ImGui::SameLine();
2581  ImGui::Text("%.0f/%.0f", scroll_x, scroll_max_x);
2582  if (scroll_x_delta != 0.0f)
2583  {
2584  // Demonstrate a trick: you can use Begin to set yourself in the context of another window
2585  // (here we are already out of your child window)
2586  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling");
2587  ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGui::GetScrollX() + scroll_x_delta);
2588  ImGui::EndChild();
2589  }
2590  ImGui::Spacing();
2591 
2592  static bool show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window = false;
2593  ImGui::Checkbox("Show Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window);
2594 
2595  if (show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window)
2596  {
2597  static bool show_h_scrollbar = true;
2598  static bool show_button = true;
2599  static bool show_tree_nodes = true;
2600  static bool show_text_wrapped = false;
2601  static bool show_columns = true;
2602  static bool show_tab_bar = true;
2603  static bool show_child = false;
2604  static bool explicit_content_size = false;
2605  static float contents_size_x = 300.0f;
2606  if (explicit_content_size)
2607  ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(contents_size_x, 0.0f));
2608  ImGui::Begin("Horizontal contents size demo window", &show_horizontal_contents_size_demo_window, show_h_scrollbar ? ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar : 0);
2609  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(2, 0));
2610  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2, 0));
2611  HelpMarker("Test of different widgets react and impact the work rectangle growing when horizontal scrolling is enabled.\n\nUse 'Metrics->Tools->Show windows rectangles' to visualize rectangles.");
2612  ImGui::Checkbox("H-scrollbar", &show_h_scrollbar);
2613  ImGui::Checkbox("Button", &show_button); // Will grow contents size (unless explicitly overwritten)
2614  ImGui::Checkbox("Tree nodes", &show_tree_nodes); // Will grow contents size and display highlight over full width
2615  ImGui::Checkbox("Text wrapped", &show_text_wrapped);// Will grow and use contents size
2616  ImGui::Checkbox("Columns", &show_columns); // Will use contents size
2617  ImGui::Checkbox("Tab bar", &show_tab_bar); // Will use contents size
2618  ImGui::Checkbox("Child", &show_child); // Will grow and use contents size
2619  ImGui::Checkbox("Explicit content size", &explicit_content_size);
2620  ImGui::Text("Scroll %.1f/%.1f %.1f/%.1f", ImGui::GetScrollX(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxX(), ImGui::GetScrollY(), ImGui::GetScrollMaxY());
2621  if (explicit_content_size)
2622  {
2623  ImGui::SameLine();
2624  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(100);
2625  ImGui::DragFloat("##csx", &contents_size_x);
2626  ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
2627  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(p, ImVec2(p.x + 10, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
2628  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x - 10, p.y), ImVec2(p.x + contents_size_x, p.y + 10), IM_COL32_WHITE);
2629  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2(0, 10));
2630  }
2631  ImGui::PopStyleVar(2);
2632  ImGui::Separator();
2633  if (show_button)
2634  {
2635  ImGui::Button("this is a 300-wide button", ImVec2(300, 0));
2636  }
2637  if (show_tree_nodes)
2638  {
2639  bool open = true;
2640  if (ImGui::TreeNode("this is a tree node"))
2641  {
2642  if (ImGui::TreeNode("another one of those tree node..."))
2643  {
2644  ImGui::Text("Some tree contents");
2645  ImGui::TreePop();
2646  }
2647  ImGui::TreePop();
2648  }
2649  ImGui::CollapsingHeader("CollapsingHeader", &open);
2650  }
2651  if (show_text_wrapped)
2652  {
2653  ImGui::TextWrapped("This text should automatically wrap on the edge of the work rectangle.");
2654  }
2655  if (show_columns)
2656  {
2657  ImGui::Columns(4);
2658  for (int n = 0; n < 4; n++)
2659  {
2660  ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
2661  ImGui::NextColumn();
2662  }
2663  ImGui::Columns(1);
2664  }
2665  if (show_tab_bar && ImGui::BeginTabBar("Hello"))
2666  {
2667  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("OneOneOne")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
2668  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("TwoTwoTwo")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
2669  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("ThreeThreeThree")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
2670  if (ImGui::BeginTabItem("FourFourFour")) { ImGui::EndTabItem(); }
2671  ImGui::EndTabBar();
2672  }
2673  if (show_child)
2674  {
2675  ImGui::BeginChild("child", ImVec2(0, 0), true);
2676  ImGui::EndChild();
2677  }
2678  ImGui::End();
2679  }
2680 
2681  ImGui::TreePop();
2682  }
2683 
2684  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Clipping"))
2685  {
2686  static ImVec2 size(100, 100), offset(50, 20);
2687  ImGui::TextWrapped(
2688  "On a per-widget basis we are occasionally clipping text CPU-side if it won't fit in its frame. "
2689  "Otherwise we are doing coarser clipping + passing a scissor rectangle to the renderer. "
2690  "The system is designed to try minimizing both execution and CPU/GPU rendering cost.");
2691  ImGui::DragFloat2("size", (float*)&size, 0.5f, 1.0f, 200.0f, "%.0f");
2692  ImGui::TextWrapped("(Click and drag)");
2693  ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
2694  ImVec4 clip_rect(pos.x, pos.y, pos.x + size.x, pos.y + size.y);
2695  ImGui::InvisibleButton("##dummy", size);
2696  if (ImGui::IsItemActive() && ImGui::IsMouseDragging(0))
2697  {
2698  offset.x += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.x;
2699  offset.y += ImGui::GetIO().MouseDelta.y;
2700  }
2701  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddRectFilled(pos, ImVec2(pos.x + size.x, pos.y + size.y), IM_COL32(90, 90, 120, 255));
2702  ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddText(ImGui::GetFont(), ImGui::GetFontSize()*2.0f, ImVec2(pos.x + offset.x, pos.y + offset.y), IM_COL32_WHITE, "Line 1 hello\nLine 2 clip me!", NULL, 0.0f, &clip_rect);
2703  ImGui::TreePop();
2704  }
2705 }
2706 
2707 static void ShowDemoWindowPopups()
2708 {
2709  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Popups & Modal windows"))
2710  return;
2711 
2712  // The properties of popups windows are:
2713  // - They block normal mouse hovering detection outside them. (*)
2714  // - Unless modal, they can be closed by clicking anywhere outside them, or by pressing ESCAPE.
2715  // - Their visibility state (~bool) is held internally by Dear ImGui instead of being held by the programmer as
2716  // we are used to with regular Begin() calls. User can manipulate the visibility state by calling OpenPopup().
2717  // (*) One can use IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup) to bypass it and detect hovering even
2718  // when normally blocked by a popup.
2719  // Those three properties are connected. The library needs to hold their visibility state BECAUSE it can close
2720  // popups at any time.
2721 
2722  // Typical use for regular windows:
2723  // bool my_tool_is_active = false; if (ImGui::Button("Open")) my_tool_is_active = true; [...] if (my_tool_is_active) Begin("My Tool", &my_tool_is_active) { [...] } End();
2724  // Typical use for popups:
2725  // if (ImGui::Button("Open")) ImGui::OpenPopup("MyPopup"); if (ImGui::BeginPopup("MyPopup") { [...] EndPopup(); }
2726 
2727  // With popups we have to go through a library call (here OpenPopup) to manipulate the visibility state.
2728  // This may be a bit confusing at first but it should quickly make sense. Follow on the examples below.
2729 
2730  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Popups"))
2731  {
2732  ImGui::TextWrapped(
2733  "When a popup is active, it inhibits interacting with windows that are behind the popup. "
2734  "Clicking outside the popup closes it.");
2735 
2736  static int selected_fish = -1;
2737  const char* names[] = { "Bream", "Haddock", "Mackerel", "Pollock", "Tilefish" };
2738  static bool toggles[] = { true, false, false, false, false };
2739 
2740  // Simple selection popup (if you want to show the current selection inside the Button itself,
2741  // you may want to build a string using the "###" operator to preserve a constant ID with a variable label)
2742  if (ImGui::Button("Select.."))
2743  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_select_popup");
2744  ImGui::SameLine();
2745  ImGui::TextUnformatted(selected_fish == -1 ? "<None>" : names[selected_fish]);
2746  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_select_popup"))
2747  {
2748  ImGui::Text("Aquarium");
2749  ImGui::Separator();
2750  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
2751  if (ImGui::Selectable(names[i]))
2752  selected_fish = i;
2753  ImGui::EndPopup();
2754  }
2755 
2756  // Showing a menu with toggles
2757  if (ImGui::Button("Toggle.."))
2758  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_toggle_popup");
2759  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_toggle_popup"))
2760  {
2761  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
2762  ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
2763  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
2764  {
2765  ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
2766  ImGui::EndMenu();
2767  }
2768 
2769  ImGui::Separator();
2770  ImGui::Text("Tooltip here");
2771  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2772  ImGui::SetTooltip("I am a tooltip over a popup");
2773 
2774  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
2775  ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
2776  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
2777  {
2778  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(names); i++)
2779  ImGui::MenuItem(names[i], "", &toggles[i]);
2780  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Sub-menu"))
2781  {
2782  ImGui::MenuItem("Click me");
2783  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked Popup"))
2784  ImGui::OpenPopup("another popup");
2785  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("another popup"))
2786  {
2787  ImGui::Text("I am the last one here.");
2788  ImGui::EndPopup();
2789  }
2790  ImGui::EndMenu();
2791  }
2792  ImGui::EndPopup();
2793  }
2794  ImGui::EndPopup();
2795  }
2796 
2797  // Call the more complete ShowExampleMenuFile which we use in various places of this demo
2798  if (ImGui::Button("File Menu.."))
2799  ImGui::OpenPopup("my_file_popup");
2800  if (ImGui::BeginPopup("my_file_popup"))
2801  {
2802  ShowExampleMenuFile();
2803  ImGui::EndPopup();
2804  }
2805 
2806  ImGui::TreePop();
2807  }
2808 
2809  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Context menus"))
2810  {
2811  // BeginPopupContextItem() is a helper to provide common/simple popup behavior of essentially doing:
2812  // if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
2813  // OpenPopup(id);
2814  // return BeginPopup(id);
2815  // For more advanced uses you may want to replicate and customize this code.
2816  // See details in BeginPopupContextItem().
2817  static float value = 0.5f;
2818  ImGui::Text("Value = %.3f (<-- right-click here)", value);
2819  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem("item context menu"))
2820  {
2821  if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to zero")) value = 0.0f;
2822  if (ImGui::Selectable("Set to PI")) value = 3.1415f;
2823  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(-1);
2824  ImGui::DragFloat("##Value", &value, 0.1f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
2825  ImGui::EndPopup();
2826  }
2827 
2828  // We can also use OpenPopupContextItem() which is the same as BeginPopupContextItem() but without the
2829  // Begin() call. So here we will make it that clicking on the text field with the right mouse button (1)
2830  // will toggle the visibility of the popup above.
2831  ImGui::Text("(You can also right-click me to open the same popup as above.)");
2832  ImGui::OpenPopupContextItem("item context menu", 1);
2833 
2834  // When used after an item that has an ID (e.g.Button), we can skip providing an ID to BeginPopupContextItem().
2835  // BeginPopupContextItem() will use the last item ID as the popup ID.
2836  // In addition here, we want to include your editable label inside the button label.
2837  // We use the ### operator to override the ID (read FAQ about ID for details)
2838  static char name[32] = "Label1";
2839  char buf[64];
2840  sprintf(buf, "Button: %s###Button", name); // ### operator override ID ignoring the preceding label
2841  ImGui::Button(buf);
2842  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
2843  {
2844  ImGui::Text("Edit name:");
2845  ImGui::InputText("##edit", name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name));
2846  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
2847  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
2848  ImGui::EndPopup();
2849  }
2850  ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("(<-- right-click here)");
2851 
2852  ImGui::TreePop();
2853  }
2854 
2855  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Modals"))
2856  {
2857  ImGui::TextWrapped("Modal windows are like popups but the user cannot close them by clicking outside.");
2858 
2859  if (ImGui::Button("Delete.."))
2860  ImGui::OpenPopup("Delete?");
2861 
2862  // Always center this window when appearing
2863  ImVec2 center(ImGui::GetIO().DisplaySize.x * 0.5f, ImGui::GetIO().DisplaySize.y * 0.5f);
2864  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(center, ImGuiCond_Appearing, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
2865 
2866  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Delete?", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
2867  {
2868  ImGui::Text("All those beautiful files will be deleted.\nThis operation cannot be undone!\n\n");
2869  ImGui::Separator();
2870 
2871  //static int dummy_i = 0;
2872  //ImGui::Combo("Combo", &dummy_i, "Delete\0Delete harder\0");
2873 
2874  static bool dont_ask_me_next_time = false;
2875  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
2876  ImGui::Checkbox("Don't ask me next time", &dont_ask_me_next_time);
2877  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2878 
2879  if (ImGui::Button("OK", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
2880  ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
2881  ImGui::SameLine();
2882  if (ImGui::Button("Cancel", ImVec2(120, 0))) { ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup(); }
2883  ImGui::EndPopup();
2884  }
2885 
2886  if (ImGui::Button("Stacked modals.."))
2887  ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 1");
2888  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 1", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar))
2889  {
2890  if (ImGui::BeginMenuBar())
2891  {
2892  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("File"))
2893  {
2894  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Dummy menu item")) {}
2895  ImGui::EndMenu();
2896  }
2897  ImGui::EndMenuBar();
2898  }
2899  ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The First\nUsing style.Colors[ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg] behind it.");
2900 
2901  // Testing behavior of widgets stacking their own regular popups over the modal.
2902  static int item = 1;
2903  static float color[4] = { 0.4f, 0.7f, 0.0f, 0.5f };
2904  ImGui::Combo("Combo", &item, "aaaa\0bbbb\0cccc\0dddd\0eeee\0\0");
2905  ImGui::ColorEdit4("color", color);
2906 
2907  if (ImGui::Button("Add another modal.."))
2908  ImGui::OpenPopup("Stacked 2");
2909 
2910  // Also demonstrate passing a bool* to BeginPopupModal(), this will create a regular close button which
2911  // will close the popup. Note that the visibility state of popups is owned by imgui, so the input value
2912  // of the bool actually doesn't matter here.
2913  bool dummy_open = true;
2914  if (ImGui::BeginPopupModal("Stacked 2", &dummy_open))
2915  {
2916  ImGui::Text("Hello from Stacked The Second!");
2917  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
2918  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
2919  ImGui::EndPopup();
2920  }
2921 
2922  if (ImGui::Button("Close"))
2923  ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup();
2924  ImGui::EndPopup();
2925  }
2926 
2927  ImGui::TreePop();
2928  }
2929 
2930  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Menus inside a regular window"))
2931  {
2932  ImGui::TextWrapped("Below we are testing adding menu items to a regular window. It's rather unusual but should work!");
2933  ImGui::Separator();
2934 
2935  // Note: As a quirk in this very specific example, we want to differentiate the parent of this menu from the
2936  // parent of the various popup menus above. To do so we are encloding the items in a PushID()/PopID() block
2937  // to make them two different menusets. If we don't, opening any popup above and hovering our menu here would
2938  // open it. This is because once a menu is active, we allow to switch to a sibling menu by just hovering on it,
2939  // which is the desired behavior for regular menus.
2940  ImGui::PushID("foo");
2941  ImGui::MenuItem("Menu item", "CTRL+M");
2942  if (ImGui::BeginMenu("Menu inside a regular window"))
2943  {
2944  ShowExampleMenuFile();
2945  ImGui::EndMenu();
2946  }
2947  ImGui::PopID();
2948  ImGui::Separator();
2949  ImGui::TreePop();
2950  }
2951 }
2952 
2953 static void ShowDemoWindowColumns()
2954 {
2955  if (!ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Columns"))
2956  return;
2957 
2958  ImGui::PushID("Columns");
2959 
2960  static bool disable_indent = false;
2961  ImGui::Checkbox("Disable tree indentation", &disable_indent);
2962  ImGui::SameLine();
2963  HelpMarker("Disable the indenting of tree nodes so demo columns can use the full window width.");
2964  if (disable_indent)
2965  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, 0.0f);
2966 
2967  // Basic columns
2968  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Basic"))
2969  {
2970  ImGui::Text("Without border:");
2971  ImGui::Columns(3, "mycolumns3", false); // 3-ways, no border
2972  ImGui::Separator();
2973  for (int n = 0; n < 14; n++)
2974  {
2975  char label[32];
2976  sprintf(label, "Item %d", n);
2977  if (ImGui::Selectable(label)) {}
2978  //if (ImGui::Button(label, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN,0.0f))) {}
2979  ImGui::NextColumn();
2980  }
2981  ImGui::Columns(1);
2982  ImGui::Separator();
2983 
2984  ImGui::Text("With border:");
2985  ImGui::Columns(4, "mycolumns"); // 4-ways, with border
2986  ImGui::Separator();
2987  ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();
2988  ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();
2989  ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();
2990  ImGui::Text("Hovered"); ImGui::NextColumn();
2991  ImGui::Separator();
2992  const char* names[3] = { "One", "Two", "Three" };
2993  const char* paths[3] = { "/path/one", "/path/two", "/path/three" };
2994  static int selected = -1;
2995  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
2996  {
2997  char label[32];
2998  sprintf(label, "%04d", i);
2999  if (ImGui::Selectable(label, selected == i, ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns))
3000  selected = i;
3001  bool hovered = ImGui::IsItemHovered();
3002  ImGui::NextColumn();
3003  ImGui::Text(names[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
3004  ImGui::Text(paths[i]); ImGui::NextColumn();
3005  ImGui::Text("%d", hovered); ImGui::NextColumn();
3006  }
3007  ImGui::Columns(1);
3008  ImGui::Separator();
3009  ImGui::TreePop();
3010  }
3011 
3012  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Borders"))
3013  {
3014  // NB: Future columns API should allow automatic horizontal borders.
3015  static bool h_borders = true;
3016  static bool v_borders = true;
3017  static int columns_count = 4;
3018  const int lines_count = 3;
3019  ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 8);
3020  ImGui::DragInt("##columns_count", &columns_count, 0.1f, 2, 10, "%d columns");
3021  if (columns_count < 2)
3022  columns_count = 2;
3023  ImGui::SameLine();
3024  ImGui::Checkbox("horizontal", &h_borders);
3025  ImGui::SameLine();
3026  ImGui::Checkbox("vertical", &v_borders);
3027  ImGui::Columns(columns_count, NULL, v_borders);
3028  for (int i = 0; i < columns_count * lines_count; i++)
3029  {
3030  if (h_borders && ImGui::GetColumnIndex() == 0)
3031  ImGui::Separator();
3032  ImGui::Text("%c%c%c", 'a' + i, 'a' + i, 'a' + i);
3033  ImGui::Text("Width %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnWidth());
3034  ImGui::Text("Avail %.2f", ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail().x);
3035  ImGui::Text("Offset %.2f", ImGui::GetColumnOffset());
3036  ImGui::Text("Long text that is likely to clip");
3037  ImGui::Button("Button", ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, 0.0f));
3038  ImGui::NextColumn();
3039  }
3040  ImGui::Columns(1);
3041  if (h_borders)
3042  ImGui::Separator();
3043  ImGui::TreePop();
3044  }
3045 
3046  // Create multiple items in a same cell before switching to next column
3047  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mixed items"))
3048  {
3049  ImGui::Columns(3, "mixed");
3050  ImGui::Separator();
3051 
3052  ImGui::Text("Hello");
3053  ImGui::Button("Banana");
3054  ImGui::NextColumn();
3055 
3056  ImGui::Text("ImGui");
3057  ImGui::Button("Apple");
3058  static float foo = 1.0f;
3059  ImGui::InputFloat("red", &foo, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
3060  ImGui::Text("An extra line here.");
3061  ImGui::NextColumn();
3062 
3063  ImGui::Text("Sailor");
3064  ImGui::Button("Corniflower");
3065  static float bar = 1.0f;
3066  ImGui::InputFloat("blue", &bar, 0.05f, 0, "%.3f");
3067  ImGui::NextColumn();
3068 
3069  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category A")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
3070  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category B")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
3071  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Category C")) { ImGui::Text("Blah blah blah"); } ImGui::NextColumn();
3072  ImGui::Columns(1);
3073  ImGui::Separator();
3074  ImGui::TreePop();
3075  }
3076 
3077  // Word wrapping
3078  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Word-wrapping"))
3079  {
3080  ImGui::Columns(2, "word-wrapping");
3081  ImGui::Separator();
3082  ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
3083  ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Left");
3084  ImGui::NextColumn();
3085  ImGui::TextWrapped("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.");
3086  ImGui::TextWrapped("Hello Right");
3087  ImGui::Columns(1);
3088  ImGui::Separator();
3089  ImGui::TreePop();
3090  }
3091 
3092  // Scrolling columns
3093  /*
3094  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Vertical Scrolling"))
3095  {
3096  ImGui::BeginChild("##header", ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()+ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y));
3097  ImGui::Columns(3);
3098  ImGui::Text("ID"); ImGui::NextColumn();
3099  ImGui::Text("Name"); ImGui::NextColumn();
3100  ImGui::Text("Path"); ImGui::NextColumn();
3101  ImGui::Columns(1);
3102  ImGui::Separator();
3103  ImGui::EndChild();
3104  ImGui::BeginChild("##scrollingregion", ImVec2(0, 60));
3105  ImGui::Columns(3);
3106  for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
3107  {
3108  ImGui::Text("%04d", i); ImGui::NextColumn();
3109  ImGui::Text("Foobar"); ImGui::NextColumn();
3110  ImGui::Text("/path/foobar/%04d/", i); ImGui::NextColumn();
3111  }
3112  ImGui::Columns(1);
3113  ImGui::EndChild();
3114  ImGui::TreePop();
3115  }
3116  */
3117 
3118  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Horizontal Scrolling"))
3119  {
3120  ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(1500.0f, 0.0f));
3121  ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetFontSize() * 20.0f);
3122  ImGui::BeginChild("##ScrollingRegion", child_size, false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
3123  ImGui::Columns(10);
3124  int ITEMS_COUNT = 2000;
3125  ImGuiListClipper clipper(ITEMS_COUNT); // Also demonstrate using the clipper for large list
3126  while (clipper.Step())
3127  {
3128  for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
3129  for (int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
3130  {
3131  ImGui::Text("Line %d Column %d...", i, j);
3132  ImGui::NextColumn();
3133  }
3134  }
3135  ImGui::Columns(1);
3136  ImGui::EndChild();
3137  ImGui::TreePop();
3138  }
3139 
3140  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree"))
3141  {
3142  ImGui::Columns(2, "tree", true);
3143  for (int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
3144  {
3145  bool open1 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)x, "Node%d", x);
3146  ImGui::NextColumn();
3147  ImGui::Text("Node contents");
3148  ImGui::NextColumn();
3149  if (open1)
3150  {
3151  for (int y = 0; y < 3; y++)
3152  {
3153  bool open2 = ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)y, "Node%d.%d", x, y);
3154  ImGui::NextColumn();
3155  ImGui::Text("Node contents");
3156  if (open2)
3157  {
3158  ImGui::Text("Even more contents");
3159  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tree in column"))
3160  {
3161  ImGui::Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
3162  ImGui::TreePop();
3163  }
3164  }
3165  ImGui::NextColumn();
3166  if (open2)
3167  ImGui::TreePop();
3168  }
3169  ImGui::TreePop();
3170  }
3171  }
3172  ImGui::Columns(1);
3173  ImGui::TreePop();
3174  }
3175 
3176  if (disable_indent)
3177  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3178  ImGui::PopID();
3179 }
3180 
3181 static void ShowDemoWindowMisc()
3182 {
3183  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Filtering"))
3184  {
3185  // Helper class to easy setup a text filter.
3186  // You may want to implement a more feature-full filtering scheme in your own application.
3187  static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
3188  ImGui::Text("Filter usage:\n"
3189  " \"\" display all lines\n"
3190  " \"xxx\" display lines containing \"xxx\"\n"
3191  " \"xxx,yyy\" display lines containing \"xxx\" or \"yyy\"\n"
3192  " \"-xxx\" hide lines containing \"xxx\"");
3193  filter.Draw();
3194  const char* lines[] = { "aaa1.c", "bbb1.c", "ccc1.c", "aaa2.cpp", "bbb2.cpp", "ccc2.cpp", "abc.h", "hello, world" };
3195  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(lines); i++)
3196  if (filter.PassFilter(lines[i]))
3197  ImGui::BulletText("%s", lines[i]);
3198  }
3199 
3200  if (ImGui::CollapsingHeader("Inputs, Navigation & Focus"))
3201  {
3202  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
3203 
3204  // Display ImGuiIO output flags
3205  ImGui::Text("WantCaptureMouse: %d", io.WantCaptureMouse);
3206  ImGui::Text("WantCaptureKeyboard: %d", io.WantCaptureKeyboard);
3207  ImGui::Text("WantTextInput: %d", io.WantTextInput);
3208  ImGui::Text("WantSetMousePos: %d", io.WantSetMousePos);
3209  ImGui::Text("NavActive: %d, NavVisible: %d", io.NavActive, io.NavVisible);
3210 
3211  // Display Keyboard/Mouse state
3212  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Keyboard, Mouse & Navigation State"))
3213  {
3214  if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
3215  ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: (%g, %g)", io.MousePos.x, io.MousePos.y);
3216  else
3217  ImGui::Text("Mouse pos: <INVALID>");
3218  ImGui::Text("Mouse delta: (%g, %g)", io.MouseDelta.x, io.MouseDelta.y);
3219  ImGui::Text("Mouse down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (io.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d (%.02f secs)", i, io.MouseDownDuration[i]); }
3220  ImGui::Text("Mouse clicked:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i); }
3221  ImGui::Text("Mouse dblclick:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i); }
3222  ImGui::Text("Mouse released:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.MouseDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsMouseReleased(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("b%d", i); }
3223  ImGui::Text("Mouse wheel: %.1f", io.MouseWheel);
3224 
3225  ImGui::Text("Keys down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (io.KeysDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X) (%.02f secs)", i, i, io.KeysDownDuration[i]); }
3226  ImGui::Text("Keys pressed:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X)", i, i); }
3227  ImGui::Text("Keys release:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.KeysDown); i++) if (ImGui::IsKeyReleased(i)) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("%d (0x%X)", i, i); }
3228  ImGui::Text("Keys mods: %s%s%s%s", io.KeyCtrl ? "CTRL " : "", io.KeyShift ? "SHIFT " : "", io.KeyAlt ? "ALT " : "", io.KeySuper ? "SUPER " : "");
3229  ImGui::Text("Chars queue:"); for (int i = 0; i < io.InputQueueCharacters.Size; i++) { ImWchar c = io.InputQueueCharacters[i]; ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("\'%c\' (0x%04X)", (c > ' ' && c <= 255) ? (char)c : '?', c); } // FIXME: We should convert 'c' to UTF-8 here but the functions are not public.
3230 
3231  ImGui::Text("NavInputs down:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++) if (io.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("[%d] %.2f", i, io.NavInputs[i]); }
3232  ImGui::Text("NavInputs pressed:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++) if (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] == 0.0f) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("[%d]", i); }
3233  ImGui::Text("NavInputs duration:"); for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++) if (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f) { ImGui::SameLine(); ImGui::Text("[%d] %.2f", i, io.NavInputsDownDuration[i]); }
3234 
3235  ImGui::Button("Hovering me sets the\nkeyboard capture flag");
3236  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
3237  ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(true);
3238  ImGui::SameLine();
3239  ImGui::Button("Holding me clears the\nthe keyboard capture flag");
3240  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
3241  ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(false);
3242 
3243  ImGui::TreePop();
3244  }
3245 
3246  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Tabbing"))
3247  {
3248  ImGui::Text("Use TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
3249  static char buf[32] = "dummy";
3250  ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3251  ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3252  ImGui::InputText("3", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3253  ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
3254  ImGui::InputText("4 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3255  //ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker("Use ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool) to disable tabbing through certain widgets.");
3256  ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
3257  ImGui::InputText("5", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3258  ImGui::TreePop();
3259  }
3260 
3261  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Focus from code"))
3262  {
3263  bool focus_1 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 1"); ImGui::SameLine();
3264  bool focus_2 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 2"); ImGui::SameLine();
3265  bool focus_3 = ImGui::Button("Focus on 3");
3266  int has_focus = 0;
3267  static char buf[128] = "click on a button to set focus";
3268 
3269  if (focus_1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
3270  ImGui::InputText("1", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3271  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 1;
3272 
3273  if (focus_2) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
3274  ImGui::InputText("2", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3275  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 2;
3276 
3277  ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
3278  if (focus_3) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere();
3279  ImGui::InputText("3 (tab skip)", buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf));
3280  if (ImGui::IsItemActive()) has_focus = 3;
3281  ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
3282 
3283  if (has_focus)
3284  ImGui::Text("Item with focus: %d", has_focus);
3285  else
3286  ImGui::Text("Item with focus: <none>");
3287 
3288  // Use >= 0 parameter to SetKeyboardFocusHere() to focus an upcoming item
3289  static float f3[3] = { 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f };
3290  int focus_ahead = -1;
3291  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on X")) { focus_ahead = 0; } ImGui::SameLine();
3292  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Y")) { focus_ahead = 1; } ImGui::SameLine();
3293  if (ImGui::Button("Focus on Z")) { focus_ahead = 2; }
3294  if (focus_ahead != -1) ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(focus_ahead);
3295  ImGui::SliderFloat3("Float3", &f3[0], 0.0f, 1.0f);
3296 
3297  ImGui::TextWrapped("NB: Cursor & selection are preserved when refocusing last used item in code.");
3298  ImGui::TreePop();
3299  }
3300 
3301  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Dragging"))
3302  {
3303  ImGui::TextWrapped("You can use ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0) to query for the dragged amount on any widget.");
3304  for (int button = 0; button < 3; button++)
3305  {
3306  ImGui::Text("IsMouseDragging(%d):", button);
3307  ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button));
3308  ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 0.0f));
3309  ImGui::Text(" w/ large threshold: %d,", ImGui::IsMouseDragging(button, 20.0f));
3310  }
3311 
3312  ImGui::Button("Drag Me");
3313  if (ImGui::IsItemActive())
3314  ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()->AddLine(io.MouseClickedPos[0], io.MousePos, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Button), 4.0f); // Draw a line between the button and the mouse cursor
3315 
3316  // Drag operations gets "unlocked" when the mouse has moved past a certain threshold
3317  // (the default threshold is stored in io.MouseDragThreshold). You can request a lower or higher
3318  // threshold using the second parameter of IsMouseDragging() and GetMouseDragDelta().
3319  ImVec2 value_raw = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0, 0.0f);
3320  ImVec2 value_with_lock_threshold = ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(0);
3321  ImVec2 mouse_delta = io.MouseDelta;
3322  ImGui::Text("GetMouseDragDelta(0):");
3323  ImGui::Text(" w/ default threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_with_lock_threshold.x, value_with_lock_threshold.y);
3324  ImGui::Text(" w/ zero threshold: (%.1f, %.1f)", value_raw.x, value_raw.y);
3325  ImGui::Text("io.MouseDelta: (%.1f, %.1f)", mouse_delta.x, mouse_delta.y);
3326  ImGui::TreePop();
3327  }
3328 
3329  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Mouse cursors"))
3330  {
3331  const char* mouse_cursors_names[] = { "Arrow", "TextInput", "ResizeAll", "ResizeNS", "ResizeEW", "ResizeNESW", "ResizeNWSE", "Hand", "NotAllowed" };
3332  IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(mouse_cursors_names) == ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT);
3333 
3334  ImGuiMouseCursor current = ImGui::GetMouseCursor();
3335  ImGui::Text("Current mouse cursor = %d: %s", current, mouse_cursors_names[current]);
3336  ImGui::Text("Hover to see mouse cursors:");
3337  ImGui::SameLine(); HelpMarker(
3338  "Your application can render a different mouse cursor based on what ImGui::GetMouseCursor() returns. "
3339  "If software cursor rendering (io.MouseDrawCursor) is set ImGui will draw the right cursor for you, "
3340  "otherwise your backend needs to handle it.");
3341  for (int i = 0; i < ImGuiMouseCursor_COUNT; i++)
3342  {
3343  char label[32];
3344  sprintf(label, "Mouse cursor %d: %s", i, mouse_cursors_names[i]);
3345  ImGui::Bullet(); ImGui::Selectable(label, false);
3346  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered() || ImGui::IsItemFocused())
3347  ImGui::SetMouseCursor(i);
3348  }
3349  ImGui::TreePop();
3350  }
3351  }
3352 }
3353 
3354 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3355 // [SECTION] About Window / ShowAboutWindow()
3356 // Access from Dear ImGui Demo -> Tools -> About
3357 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3358 
3359 void ImGui::ShowAboutWindow(bool* p_open)
3360 {
3361  if (!ImGui::Begin("About Dear ImGui", p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3362  {
3363  ImGui::End();
3364  return;
3365  }
3366  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui %s", ImGui::GetVersion());
3367  ImGui::Separator();
3368  ImGui::Text("By Omar Cornut and all Dear ImGui contributors.");
3369  ImGui::Text("Dear ImGui is licensed under the MIT License, see LICENSE for more information.");
3370 
3371  static bool show_config_info = false;
3372  ImGui::Checkbox("Config/Build Information", &show_config_info);
3373  if (show_config_info)
3374  {
3375  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
3376  ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
3377 
3378  bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::Button("Copy to clipboard");
3379  ImVec2 child_size = ImVec2(0, ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing() * 18);
3380  ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGui::GetID("cfg_infos"), child_size, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove);
3381  if (copy_to_clipboard)
3382  {
3383  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
3384  ImGui::LogText("```\n"); // Back quotes will make text appears without formatting when pasting on GitHub
